clinical_study.official_title: Airway Ultrasound to Predict Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome in Children and Its Correlation With Clinical Signs and Symptoms of Obstructive Sleep Apnea

brief_summary.textblock: This is a novel approach to assess the use of ultrasound to support the identification of obstructive sleep apnea syndrome (OSAS) on a screening questionnaire, and potentially to predict a difficult pediatric airway. The investigators hope to determine if a combination of simple bedside clinical tests can be used to identify OSAS in patients who present for surgery with clinical signs of OSAS but without a formal polysomnography.

primary_outcome.description: The distance from the hyoid bone to the mentum to predict difficult airway.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after being intubated in surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Width of the tongue between the lingual arteries.
